## SDQ vs RPQ

SDQ vs RPQ Understanding the nature of behavioural patterns in young individuals is critically important to researchers in behavioural science. SDQ and RPQ are two robust tools employed for this purpose. The Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) focuses on general behaviours in children while the Reactive-Proactive Questionnaire (RPQ) specializes in studying aggression. However, when comparing **SDQ vs RPQ**, the process can be time-consuming and subjective. This is where Harmony's advanced technology becomes valuable. The software can help researchers harmonise the items from SDQ and RPQ while presenting them with detailed comparisons. Harmony uses superior language processing models and scales execution in multiple languages, making it an incredibly versatile tool in cross-cultural studies. Therefore, when it comes to **SDQ vs RPQ** studies, Harmony can make your research remarkably efficient. By simply selecting instruments from the existing database or uploading your own, Harmonyâ€™s easy-to-use web interface facilitates a seamless harmonisation of data. Through such pioneering efforts, comparative studies of **SDQ vs RPQ** can become more accurate, reliable and time-saving. We highly recommend using [Harmony](https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app) for all your behavioural research needs.

## Compare the items in SDQ and RPQ

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and RPQ into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just RPQ into Harmony</a> - compare RPQ with other instruments
